symptoms.name: Diarrhea
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be severe leading to dehydration
symptoms.pattern: Within 8 to 72 hours after exposure, lasting up to 10 days

symptoms.name: Fever
symptoms.pattern: Within 8 to 72 hours after exposure, resolving within 48-72 hours in some cases

symptoms.name: Dehydration
symptoms.pattern: Can occur as a result of severe diarrhea

vital_signs.blood_pressure: Potentially low in case of severe dehydration

physical_findings: Signs of dehydration (dry mucous membranes, decreased skin turgor)

lab_values.complete_blood_count: Potentially showing leukocytosis (increased white blood cell count)

risk_factors: Consumption of contaminated food or water
Travel to countries with poor sanitation
Weakened immune system (e.g., infants, young children, older adults, immunocompromised individuals)
